title: Project Planning and Requirements Gathering
description: Define project scope, objectives, and requirements. Conduct research on quantum computing concepts and simulation techniques. Identify target audience and their needs.

title: Architecture Design and System Planning
description: Design the overall system architecture, including the simulation engine, user interface, and data storage components. Define the technology stack, development tools, and consider performance optimization strategies for interactive coding exercises.

title: User Interface Design and Development
description: Design and develop the user interface for the simulation environment, including interactive coding exercises, visualization tools, and user feedback mechanisms.

title: Quantum Computing Simulation Engine Development
description: Implement the core simulation engine that models quantum computing concepts and executes user-provided code. Integrate with the user interface and data storage components.

title: Data Storage and Persistence
description: Design and implement a scalable, secure, and efficient data storage solution for user code, simulation results, user data, and other relevant data in the Quantum Computing Simulator project. The solution should leverage appropriate combinations of relational databases (such as PostgreSQL or MySQL), NoSQL databases (like MongoDB or Cassandra), caching mechanisms (e.g., Redis), and file storage systems (AWS S3, Google Cloud Storage) to address data integrity, security, and efficient retrieval. Implement proper data access controls and encryption for sensitive information, ensuring adherence to industry standards for data privacy and protection. Incorporate a layered caching strategy with intelligent cache eviction policies to optimize performance and reduce latency. Collaborate closely with the assigned team members and other stakeholders throughout the process. To ensure thoroughness, consider conducting benchmark tests on different database configurations before making final decisions. For better readability, structure the RFC into sections covering design choices, implementation details, security measures, caching strategies, performance metrics, and a timeline for completion. Once complete, include a section for post-implementation testing and maintenance.

title: Testing and Quality Assurance
description: Develop comprehensive test plans and test cases for the simulation environment, including unit tests, integration tests, and user acceptance tests. Ensure code quality and functionality.

title: Security and Compliance
description: Implement security measures to protect user data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.

title: Deployment and DevOps
description: Set up the deployment infrastructure and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. Ensure smooth deployment and monitoring of the application.

title: Documentation and User Guides
description: Create comprehensive documentation and user guides for the simulation environment, covering installation, usage, and advanced features.
